intro: Onosma gracilis, commonly known as slender onosma, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, contributing to its drought-resistant nature. Onosma gracilis is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
